alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 3:26PM CDT until March 31 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Rock Island County in northwestern Illinois... Northwestern Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... Northwestern Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Northeastern Scott County in east central Iowa... Southeastern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 326 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pleasant Valley, or near Bettendorf, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Port Byron around 330 PM CDT. Princeton, Cordova, Princeton Wildlife Area, Rock Creek Park, Rock Creek Marina and Campground and Folletts around 335 PM CDT. Camanche, Albany and Low Moor around 340 PM CDT. Garden Plain, East Clinton, Fenton and Newton Corners around 345 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Clinton, Fulton, Union Grove, Bulgers Hollow, Morrison, Ustick, Morrison-Rockwood State Park, Unionville, Whiteside County Fairgrounds and Malvern. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
